content.question: Which of the following best describes the trends seen in the total fertility rates for the world population from 1950 to the projected rates in 2040 ?

choices.label: Total fertility rates fell below carrying capacity after 1965 because of an increase in global conflicts.
Total fertility rates remained fairly steady from 1970 to 1985 as less-developed regions shifted to more agricultural-based economies.
Total fertility rates declined rapidly from 1960 to 2000 because women had children later in life as a result of increased educational opportunities.
Total fertility rates are projected to increase slightly from 2000 to 2040 as a result of technological advances and access to health care.

content.answer: Total fertility rates declined rapidly from 1960 to 2000 because women had children later in life as a result of increased educational opportunities.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
